segments.text: I think it’s funny how the woman is standing in a puddle and doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just drying that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are sneaking cookies right behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is about to tip, but he doesn’t seem to mind.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the girl will catch him if he falls, or if they’ll both end up in a heap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and no one seems to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like a comedy of errors, and I can’t help but laugh at the absurdity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s face is so serious, and the kids are so sneaky—it’s perfect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I bet when she finally notices, she’ll be shocked at the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But for now, she’s completely clueless, and it’s hilarious.
segments.speaker: PAR
